Name: bai tou weng
Botanical: Pulsatilla turczaninovii kryl.et Serg. (細葉白頭翁)
Pulsatilla ambigua Turcz.ex Pritz. (蒙古白頭翁)
Pulsatilla cernua (Thunb.) Bercht.et Opiz. (朝鮮白頭翁)
Pulsatilla campanella Fisch.ex Regel (鐘萼白頭翁)

Geography: Northern, Northeastern, and Central China (東北, 華北, 華中)
Medical Function: astringent effect on the mucus of intestine
Samples of Formulae: bai tou weng tang 白頭翁湯
Research: Recent work has mainly focused on the isolation and identification of compounds with 23-dihydroxy-Δ20(29)-lup-28-oic acid and betulinic acid as the mother nuclei (近來科研人員主要從事對白頭翁以23-二羥基-△20(29)-羽扇豆烯-28-酸和白樺脂酸為母核的化合物的分離鑒定).
Original Text:
bai tou weng, Complementary and Alternative Healing University

    by: Joe Hing Kwok Chu       
    (in English and Chinese 中英文)Pharmaceutical name:英文藥名﹕Radix PulsatillaeBotanical name:學名﹕Pulsatilla chinensis (Bge) Regel (廣葉白頭翁)Pulsatilla nuttalliana, Spreng.Pulsatilla daurica Spreng.Pulsatilla turczaninovii kryl.et Serg.(細葉白頭翁 )Pulsatilla ambigua Turcz.ex Pritz. (蒙古白頭翁)Pulsatilla dahurica (Fisch.exDC.) Spreng.(興安白頭翁)Pulsatilla cernua (Thunb.) Bercht.et Opiz. (朝鮮白頭翁)
Pulsatilla koreana Nakai (朝鮮白頭翁)Pulsatilla campanella Fisch.ex Regel (鐘萼白頭翁)Pron. in Japanese:日語發音﹕hakutooPron. in Korean:韓語發音﹕paektuongPron. in Cantonese:粵音﹕
      baak6 tau4 jung1Other Names:別名 ﹕bei zi cao 北紫草Common Name:英文名﹕Chinese anemone root, Chinese pulsaiilla rootDistribution:產地﹕Northern, northeaster and middle part of China.東 北 、 華 北 、 華 中 等 地 。Properties(characteristics)﹕性味﹕bitter, cold苦，寒。Channels (meridians) entered: 歸經﹕large intestine, liver, stomach.大腸，肝， 胃。Medical functions:藥理﹕ antibioticanti parasitesanti cancerkills spermstreats endotoxic toxemia抗菌抗病原虫抗癌殺精治療內毒素血症Actions & Indications:主治﹕astringent effect on the mucus of intestine.  For diarrhea and bleeding.對 腸 粘 膜 有 收 歛 作 用 ， 能 止 瀉 ， 止 血 。臨 床上主要用於治療細菌性痢疾、阿米巴痢疾、婦科陰道炎等。Chemical ingredients:化學成份﹕The main chemical ingredients are saponins, . lactone etc. Among them: Pulchinenoside A (also called A3), B, C (also called B4), D, saponin1, 2, betulinic acid, betulinicacid3-O-α-L-arabinopyranoside, 3-oxobetulinicacid, daucosterol, protoanemonin, anemonin), okinalin,C32H64O2, okinalein,C4H6O2.Pulsatilla cernua (Thunb.) Bercht.et Opiz contains: saponin2, saponin3, Cp3a, Cp2, ect. 
      See this .Pulsatilla campanella Fisch.ex Regel contains: pulsatiloside)A, B, C, D, leontoside A, B, D, calcoside D, cauloside D,F etc.主要為皂苷和內酯等成分。其中包括白頭翁皂苷 A［5］(也被命名為A3［6］)、B ［10］、C(也被命名為B4［6］)、D (pulchinenoside A、B、C、D)［7］,皂苷1(saponin1)、皂苷2 (saponin2)［8,9］,白樺酯酸(betulinic acid),白 樺脂酸-3-O-α-L-阿拉伯吡喃糖苷(betulinicacid3-O-α-L-arabinopyranoside)，3-氧代白樺脂酸(3-oxobetulinicacid)， 胡蘿卜苷(daucosterol)［10］,原白頭翁素(protoanemonin)［11］,白頭翁素(anemonin),白頭翁靈(okinalin,C32H64O2)， 白頭翁英(okinalein,C4H6O2)［12］。近來科研人員主要從事對白頭翁以23-二羥基-△20(29)-羽扇豆烯-28-酸和白 樺脂酸為母核的化合物的分離鑒定。  對其它品種的白頭翁的化學成分的研究也時有報道，朝鮮白頭翁含威靈仙表二糖皂苷(CP3a)，威靈仙二糖皂苷(CP2)，皂苷2及皂苷3。鐘萼白 頭翁含白頭翁苷(pulsatiloside)A、B、C、D，牡丹草苷(leontoside)A、B、D,驢蹄草苷(calcoside)D, 威岩仙皂苷(cauloside)D、F等。Dosage:用量﹕6 ～ 15 gSamples of formulae:
      處方舉例﹕
bai tou weng tang 白頭翁湯Modern Research:現代研究﹕ Toxicity & Cautions:毒素與禁忌﹕　参考：http://www.chinamtcm.com/html/28836.htmSponsors' Ads by Google 以下為谷歌所提供贊助者之廣告  A manuscript... writing, translating and proofreading              in progress

Research:
This herb can improve to varying degrees of the immune system of normal mice and also those of immunocompromised mice. [2]

The polysaccharide of this herb showed a two-way adjustment on proliferation of mouse T lymphocytes. [3]

General: Homopterocarpin (高紫檀素; 3,9-二甲氧基紫檀碱)

References: [2] Guangzhou University of Traditional Chinese Medicine, Journal of Traditional Chinese medicine, November2009,Vo.l26,No. 6; . 廣州中醫大學，中醫學報，2009年11月第26卷第6期
[3] Journal of Guandong Medical School, 2008, Feb, Vol. 26, No. 1; 《廣東藥學院學報》> 2008年2月26卷1期>

Maladies Treated: Amber (resin): jing feng dian xian (infantile convulsions and epilepsy)
Amber (resin): amenorrhea due to blood stasis and clots (血瘀所致的閉經)
Medical Function: Disperse stasis and stop bleeding (散瘀止血)
Calm fright and settle the spirit (鎮驚安神)
Promote urination; unblock strangury (利水通淋)
Dosage: 1.5 g to 3 g daily, in powder form taken with liquid. Not used in decoction.
Contraindications: Do not use in case of yinxu (yin deficient) with heat.

Resin (amber; hu po; Succinum): elements: carbon, hydrogen, oxygen; small amounts of sulfur, iron, magnesium, calcium, etc. (碳，氫，氧，少許硫，鐵，鎂，鈣等)

Original Text: hu po, Complementary and Alternative Healing UniversityComplementary and Alternative Healing University  Home  現代 中藥辭典Search this siteList of Health ProblemsChinese Herb DictionaryQigongTraditional Chinese Medicine (TCM)AcupuncturePrescribed Drug DictionaryBiochemistry DictionaryLecture SlidesResearch LibrarianGeneral Online LibrarySearchResearch SitesViagraMassage/AcupressureHypnotherapyTell us what you wantNotify Changes & New Information　　    　　                             hu po 琥珀 by: Joe Hing Kwok Chu   Pharmaceutical name:英文藥名﹕SuccinumPron. in Japanese:日語發音﹕kohakuPron. in Korean:韓語發音﹕hobackPron. in Cantonese::粵音﹕fu2 paak3Other Names:別名﹕xue po 血珀Common Name:英文名﹕fossil of amberDistribution:產地﹕Mainly produced in Yunnan, Guangxi, Fujian, Guizhou, Liaoning, Xinjiang, Guangdong provinces and also in Southeast Asia.主產雲南，廣西，福建，貴州，遼 寧，新疆，廣東，等 省，及 南洋諸島。Properties(characteristics)﹕性味﹕sweet, neutral.甘，平。Channels (meridians) entered: 歸經﹕heart, liver, bladder.入心，肝，膀胱經。Medical functions:藥理﹕  Actions & Indications:主治﹕Uses: rid of blood clots, to promote calming, to promote urination, for treatment of epilepsy, insomnia, blood in urine, menses stoppage due to blood stasis and clots .功用﹕散瘀止血；鎮驚安神﹐利水通淋。主 治﹕驚風癲癇，驚悸﹐失眠；治血便血尿﹐利尿，血瘀所致的 閉經。Chemical ingredients:化學成份﹕ succoxyabietic acid琥珀氧松香酸borneol ether龍腦醚Succinic acid琥珀酸succinoabietinolic acid琥珀松香酸succinosilvic acid琥珀銀松酸succinoresinol琥珀脂醇succinoabietol琥珀松香醇benzine石油醚carbon, hydrogen, oxygen, small amount of sulfur, iron, magnesium, calcium etc.碳，氫，氧，少許硫，鐵，鎂，鈣等。Daly Dosage:每日用量﹕1. 5 g to 3 g, in powder form taken with liquid. Not used in decoction.一克半 至三克。研末沖服。不入 煎劑。Samples of formulae:處方舉例﹕See: Interstitial Cystitis.  看間質性膀胱炎Modern Research:現代研究﹕ Toxicity & Cautions:毒素與禁忌﹕do not use in case of yinxu (yin deficient)  with heat.陰虛有熱忌用。Sponsors' Ads by Google 以下為谷歌所提供贊助者之廣告 A manuscript... writing, translating and proofreading  in progressClick here for comment. Name: shi da gong lao
十大功勞
Botanical: Mahonia bealei (Fort.) Carr. (闊葉十大功勞)
Berberis japonica var. (Thunb.) R. Br. var. gracillima (Fedde) REHD. (synonym)
Mahonia japonica var. (Thunb.) DC. var. gracillima Fedde (synonym)
Other: san ba huang lian 傘把黃連
da lao shu huang 大老鼠黃
yang jiao huang  羊角黃連
kuo ye shi da gong lao 闊葉十大功勞

Medical Function: Roots and stems: 清熱解毒 (clears heat and toxin)
Samples of Formulae: For wind-fire toothache (風火牙痛): Shi Da Gong Lao (Mahonia leaf) 9 g. Boil with water (decoction) and take as a single dose daily; if pain is acute, take 2 doses in one day. Source: 《江西草藥》 [1]
Contraindications: Use with caution in cases of pi xu (脾虛, Spleen deficiency).
References: [1] Zhong Hua Ben Cao 中華本草

(synonym)  Berberis napaulensis Hayata (synonym)  Ilex japonica Thunb. (synonym)  Mahonia japonica var. (Thunb.) DC. var. gracillima Fedde (synonym)  Mahonia tikushiensis Hayata (synonym)Pron. in Japanese:日語發音﹕ginanten (柊南天)　Pron. in Korean:韓語發音﹕sibdaegongloPron. in Cantonese:粵音﹕sap6 daai6 gung1 lou4Other Names:別名﹕tie ba gua 鐵八卦，tian shu ci 天鼠刺，san ba huang lian 傘把黃連，da lao shu huang 大老鼠黃，lao shu huang 老鼠黃，ci huang lian 刺黃連，yang jiao lian 羊角蓮，tu huang qin 土黃芩，yang jiao huang 羊角黃連，ba jiao yang 八角羊，tu huang lian 土黃連，tu huang bai 土黃柏，huang bai ci 黃柏刺，kuo ye shi da gong lao 闊葉十大功勞，huang bai mu 黃柏木，tian shu ci 天鼠刺Common Name:英文名﹕Japanese mahonia, Chinese mahonia.Distribution:產地﹕ Properties(characteristics)﹕性味﹕bitter, cold.苦，寒。Channels (meridians) entered: 歸經﹕large intestine, liver, stomach大腸，肝，胃。Medical functions:藥理﹕ Actions & Indications:主治 ﹕Leaves : tuberculosis, cold.Roots and stems: infections. Indications bacillary dysentery, acute gastroenteritis, infectious hepatitis, pneumonia, tuberculosis, bronchitis, sore throat. External use in: conjunctivitis, carbuncles, swollen boils, burns, scaldings.葉主治肺結核，感冒。根，莖：清熱解毒。主治細菌性痢疾，急性腸胃炎，傳染性肝炎，肺炎，肺結核，支氣管炎，咽喉腫痛。外用治眼結膜炎，癰癤腫毒，燒，燙傷。Chemical ingredients:[1]化學 成份﹕The leaves, stems and roots of Mahonia bealei (Fort.) Carr. contain:闊葉十大功勞的根，莖，葉均含:alkaloids生物鹼:Stems contain:莖含:berberine小檗鹼palmatine巴馬亭jatrorrhizine藥根鹼oxyacanthine尖刺鹼berbamine小檗胺 iso-tetrandrine異漢防己甲素 columbamine非洲防己胺Dosage:用量﹕6 ~ 9 gSamples of formulae: 處方舉例﹕For tooth infection: leaves of shi da gong lao 9 g. Boil with water. one dose a day. If pain if acute, take 2 doses. [1]治風火牙痛：十大功勞葉三錢。水煎頓服。每日一劑，痛甚者服二劑。(《江西草藥》)[1]Modern Research:現代 研究﹕ Toxicity & Cautions:毒素 與禁忌﹕not to use in case of pixu (spleen deficient).脾虛者慎用。[1] Zhong Hua Ben Cao 中華本草 看容易混亂之中藥：http://www.hkjcicm.org/cm_database/confused/detail.aspx?herb_id=42 Sponsors' Ads by Google 以下為谷歌所提供贊助者之廣告 A manuscript... writing, translating and proofreading  in progress Problems with website? Name: wu yi
蕪荑
Common: English: fruit made from stinking elm, ulmus
Other name: wu yi 無夷（《爾雅》郭璞注）
wu yi ren 蕪荑仁（《千金方》）
shan yu zi 山榆子（《千金•食治》）
shan yu ren 山榆仁（《本草拾遺》）
bai wu yi 白蕪荑（《聖惠方》）
da guo yu hu 大果榆糊（《藥材學》）

Geography: Distributed in northeastern China, northern China, and Shaanxi, Gansu, Qinghai, Jiangsu, Anhui, Henan provinces, and other places.
Maladies Treated: Tinea (including ringworm, athlete's foot and jock itch) [2]
Abdominal pain occurs immediately during eating with pale and yellowish face; pain can happen anytime due to parasites (脾胃有虫); part used: kernels (仁)
Dosage:
Oral, in decoction 3 to 10 g, or mix into pills, plaster, and powder.
External application: use appropriate amount. Grind into powder and mix into paste and apply.
Samples of Formulae:
For treatment of parasites (syndrome: pain occurs immediately during eating, pale and yellowish colour in the face, pain can happen anytime):
Prescription: wu yi (fruit made from stinking elm) kernels 60 g. Stir fry with flour till light brown. Make into powder. Mix 2 to 4 g with cooked rice water. Drink any time. Source: Qian Jin Fang.
Contraindications: Those with pixu (spleen deficient) condition should use with care. [1]
Chemical Ingredients: contains a variety of vegetable oils
References: [1] Zhong Yao Da Ci dian 中藥大辭典
[2] Zhong Hua Ben Cao 中華本草
Original Text: wu yi , Complementary and Alternative Healing UniversityComplementary and Alternative Healing University   中藥詞典                 Chinese Herb Dictionary      Search this site     在本網站找資料     Discussion FormSearch this siteList of Health ProblemsChinese Herb DictionaryQigongTraditional Chinese Medicine (TCM)AcupuncturePrescribed Drug DictionaryBiochemistry DictionaryLecture SlidesResearch LibrarianGeneral Online LibrarySearchResearch SitesViagraMassage/AcupressureHypnotherapyTell us what you wantNotify Changes & New Information　　　                 　      　　 wu yi  蕪荑          (in English and Chinese 中英文)Translated by: Joe Hing kwok Chu 朱興國編譯Pharmaceutical name:英文藥名﹕ Praeparatio Fructus Ulmus macrocarpaeBotanical name:學名﹕Ulmus macrocarpa HancePron. in Japanese:日語發音﹕bu iPron. in Korean:韓語發音﹕mujePron. in Cantonese::粵音﹕mou4 tai4Other Names:別名﹕dian tang殿蓎（《本經》）wu yi無夷（《爾雅》郭璞注）wu yi ren蕪荑仁（《千金方》）shan yu zi山榆子（《千金�食治》）shan yu ren山榆仁（《本草拾遺》）bai wu yi白蕪荑（《聖惠方》）da guo yu hu大果榆糊（《藥材學》）da guo yu大果榆Common Name:英文名﹕fruit made from stinking elm, ulmusDistribution:產地﹕Distributed in northeastern China, northern China, and Shaanxi, Gansu, Qinghai, Jiangsu, Anhui, Henan provinces, and other places.分佈於東北、華北及陝西、甘肅、青海、江蘇、安徽、河南等地。Properties(characteristics)﹕性味﹕bitter, acrid, warm.苦，辛，溫。Channels (meridians) entered: 歸經﹕spleen, stomach.脾，胃。Medical functions:藥理﹕ rid of parasitesanti fungus驅蟲抗真菌Actions & Indications:主治﹕Malnutrition in children; chronic diarrhea, dysentery; malignant sore; scabies,  tinea (including ringworm, athlete's foot and jock itch) [2]小兒疳積；久瀉久痢；惡瘡；疥癬, （包括金錢癬，香港腳，股癬) [2]Chemical ingredients: [2]化學成份﹕【2】contains a variety of vegetable oils, vitamins, tannins, sugars, a little alkaloids and saponins. 含多種植物油及維生素，鞣質，糖類， 並含少許生物鹼及皂甙。Dosage:用 量﹕Oral, in decoction 3 to 10 g, or mix into pills, plaster, and powder.External application: use appropriate amount. Grind into powder and mix into paste and appy.內服，煎湯：3～10 克。或入丹，膏，丸，散。外用適量，研末調敷。Samples of formulae:處方舉 例﹕For treatment of parasites:syndrome: pain occurs immediately during eating, pale and yellowish colour in the face, pain can happen anytime.Prescription: wu yi kernels 60 g. Stir fry with flour till light brown. Make into powder. Mix 2 to 4 g with cooked rice water. Drink any time  (Qian Jin Fang)治脾胃有虫，食即痛，面黃無色，疼痛無時：蕪荑仁二兩，和麵炒令黃色，為末，非時，米湯飲調二錢匕(大若2~4克)。（《千金方》）[1]Modern Research:現代研究﹕ Toxicity & Cautions:毒素與禁忌﹕those with pixu (spleen deficient) condition should use with care.脾虛者慎服[1]Zhong Yao Da Ci dian 中藥大辭典[2] Zhong Hua Ben Cao  中華本草http://www.zysj.com.cn/yianxinde/8/81140.html Problems with website?
